Notes: The Growing Season formula (Le- Houe  rou 1989) was employed as a mea- sure of ecological risk. A month is in- cluded in the growing season if the average daily temperature is more than 6 C.

The Growing Season formula (Le- Houe  rou 1989) was employed as a mea- sure of ecological risk. A month is in- cluded in the growing season if the total precipitation in millimeters is more than twice the average temperature in centigrade.
Ecological risk is the amount of variation which people face in their food supply over time.
Where small groups are basically self- sufficient, there is no incentive for them to form networks of primary bonds outside the immediate vicinity
languages are much more widespread, as the extensive social networks spread linguistic norms over a wider area.

increasing the number of productive households in a social network decreases the variation experienced by all of them as a simple consequence of the law of large numbers. This is true as long as there is some degree of statistical independence between them. This numerical averaging leads to the prediction that the number of individuals in a language group should increase as the degree of ecological risk increases
